_exec_summary.SummaryText:
INTRODUCTION



In response to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), this PSM/RMP document has been developed for the Bongards Premium Cheese facility located at 3001 Highway 45 West Bypass in Humboldt, Tennessee. This document has been prepared to satisfy multiple regulations and is governed by the following agencies:



?    Federal EPA's, Code of Federal Regulations, Title 40, Part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirements: Risk Management Programs Under Clean Air Act Section 112(r), Program 3 requirements (RMP).



?    OSHA's Code of Federal Regulations, Title 29, Section 1910.119, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM).



The purpose of this document is to:



?    Increase the protection of public health, the environment, and facility employees by ensuring proper emergency response and mitigation procedures when handling regulated substances.



?    Assist Bongards Premium Cheese and local government agencies in their communication and coordination efforts to improve facility safety while handling regulated substances.



This document addresses Bongards Premium Cheese administrative and operational programs to prevent accidents related to regulated substances and to reduce potential risks. The regulated substance of concern and focus of this document is anhydrous ammonia. The facility utilizes an ammonia system to provide refrigeration for the processing and storage of dairy products.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Bongards Premium Cheese is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program. This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the process equipment at the facility.



Bongards Premium Cheese senior management is not only committed to offering superior service, but al

so to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. Bongards Premium Cheese safety and environmental policies as they relate to the ammonia refrigeration system are administered by the EHS Manager, Plant Manager, and Refrigeration Operator who conduct inspections of the facility to ensure compliance.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The Bongards Premium Cheese facility is located at 3001 Highway 45 West Bypass in Humboldt, Tennessee, which is approximately 0.1 miles north of Highway 45 and 0.2 miles west of Highway 187.



The primary business of Bongards Premium Cheese is to provide refrigeration for the processing and storage of dairy products. In order to conduct operations, the facility maintains 2 refrigeration system containing approximately (New) 15,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia and (Old) 12,100 pounds of anhydrous ammonia, a regulated substance. The refrigeration system, consisting of piping, valves, and equipment, cycles ammonia through various physical states (high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, and then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provide refrigeration for processing and storage of dairy products. Typical operating conditions range from 15 psig on the low pressure side of the system to 150-170 psig on the high side.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The Bongards Premium Cheese ammonia refrigeration systems has many safety features. Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system. For example, the facility operates in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation. The facility conducts preventative maintenance and any necessary minor repairs and major repairs in house, but an outside contractor is hired for major repairs or maintenance as needed.



The facility, in

cluding the ammonia systems, was designed and constructed in accordance with the Uniform Mechanical Code applicable at the time of construction, which specifically outlines requirements for the safe operation of the ammonia refrigeration system. These safety features include ammonia sensors in the Engine Room. In addition, the majority of the ammonia is maintained inside the engine rooms and just outside of the engine room. All pressure vessels are for the new system are located in the new engine room. The pressure vessels for the old system is located in the old engine room and just outside the old engine room



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Bongards Premium Cheese has an emergency action plan in effect. The Emergency Action Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Planning and Response section of this PSM/RMP document. This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:

1.)  To save lives.

2.) To minimize and avoid injuries. 

3.)  To protect the environment.

4.)  To minimize property damage.



Bongards Premium Cheese maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility. This Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures, which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility. This Plan is reviewed and updated at least once per year. This Plan was reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations.



In case of an ammonia emergency, the facility plans to evacuate all employees and contractors and activate the facility's action plan to respond to the situation. If necessary, they will alert the local emergency responders (fire department) for assistance. The facility plans to coordinate emergency response efforts with the fire department on a periodic and ongoing basis.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The Process Hazards Analysis, for t

he new system was conducted on June 5-7, 2018, included a What-If study and a Facility Inspection, provided mitigation measures to improve safety at the Bongards Premium Cheese facility. The Process Hazards Analysis was last reviewed, for the old system on August 28, 2014, included a What-If study and a Facility Inspection, provided mitigation measures to improve safety at the Bongards Premium Cheese facility.         The Bongards Premium Cheese management team is planning to complete several items over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees. These changes include the following items:



1.    Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety Plan/Programs.



2.    Continue to have employee involvement in Safety Plan Development.



3.    Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.



4.    Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.
